title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The process was very easy and straight-forward. The manager and department head were very easy to talk to and created a very natural, conversation, rather than a structured Q&A session.
Interview Questions: What was you previous experience in this setting and what is it about this setting that makes you want to work in it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center (Monterey Park, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The first was, tell me about yourself and then I was asked patient case scenario questions. What would you do if patient xyz, what would you do if the doctor xyz. The questions were all critical thinking skills.
Interview Questions: If you received a new patient post op, what is the number one thing you would look for and expect.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Will receive a time via email prior to interview. Show up 30 minutes prior, parking may be hard to find. Sign in at human resources building. staff will call manager, etc to interview you.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
why this hospital?
why should we pick you over other candidates?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: You meet with supervisor  first simple questions more of a conversation and then you meet with the coo of the company. He then questions your qualities and experience. He will offer the job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Great  and efficient and more   Respe了cted each other coworker  ! Happy and  fun to work Environment ！ grow about my career ! Yes I! We don’t love to have chance to work here again.

title: Registered Nurse Newgrad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center (Monterey Park, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty easy and straightforward. I was interviewed with 2 unit directors, they were both very nice and friendly.  The whole process took about 20-30 mins. I got my offer a couple of days later.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and weakness?

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Lots of clinical questions, but the director was very nice and did not intimidate me during the process. This was a Zoom interview because  of COVID.  The interview lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: what is an A-Fib and how does it effect the heart

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty lengthy and very much based on clinical knowledge. I was interviewed by the director of the unit over zoom. He was very nice and seemed interested in getting to know me.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our hospital?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: you submit your application. you wait for hr to email you. they ask for your certificates. they then give it to the director or the floor. from there the director will decide whether he/she wants to interview you. from there hr will email you for an interview. you wait for an offer letter. then you either accept or deny. and then they start you with training.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center (Monterey Park, CA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Some clinical based questions mixed in with personality questions. Since I was a new grad nurse they wanted to know where I would be in three years and see if I was okay working night shift.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in three years as a nurse on our unit?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center (Monterey Park, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, entire process took a week. Supervisor called and set up an interview, went into a panel interview with a total of 5 interviewers at once. A little disorganized, some people were asking the same question, asked more questions after the interview was supposed to be over. Received a call back with the offer a few days later.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center (Monterey Park, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Tell me about yourself. Situational questions, what would you do.  Tell me about your last job and what you did. Why did you choose to become a nurse

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Garfield Medical Center (Monterey Park, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Short interview during career fair with the hiring manager and two clinical managers. Few days after I was called for a panel interview with all the clinical nursing managers that took at least an hour.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.  Why did you leave your former employer?How long have you been out of work? Why do you want to work here? What is your clinical publication is all about? Do you have experience with pediatric patient? Is it ok if you will be asked to work night shift few times a week if needed? What is the difficult case you have ever encountered ? What are your specialties?
When can you start? Do you have questions for us? (  still few more questions  that I can not recall)
